model.Generators.GraphTheory

Class GraphTheory

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.Generators.GraphTheory.GraphTheory
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Generator

    public class GraphTheory
extends java.lang.Object
implements Generator
    Class used to generate De Bruijn words using directed graphs

      private java.util.ArrayList<Edge> findEulerianPath(Graph graph, Node startNode)
      Finds a Eulerian path in a graph if one exists Will start from the given Node if it is not null
      private static void forwardHelper(java.util.ArrayDeque<Edge> forward, Edge edge, Graph graph)
      Helper method Constructs list of unvisited Edges starting from the given Edge Marks each Edge as visited Ends when no further extension can be made
      java.lang.String generateDeBruijnWord(int k, int n)
      Returns a valid De Bruijn word for values k and n Word is calculated by result of Hierholzers algorithm given Graph of size n-1
      java.lang.String generateDeBruijnWord(int k, int n, java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> prohibit)
      Returns a valid De Bruijn word for values k and n, not containing any codes in given list of prohibited codes Word is calculated by result of Hierholzers algorithm given Graph of size n-1 and prohibited codes
      java.lang.String generateDeBruijnWord(int k, int n, java.lang.String startNode)
      Returns a valid De Bruijn word for values k and n, beginning with the given code Word is calculated by result of Hierholzers algorithm given Graph of size n-1 and code to start with
      private static void populateDeBruijnGraph(int k, int n, Graph graph, java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> prohibit)
      Populates a Graph object with Nodes and Edges to create a De Bruijn graph for values k and n

      • populateDeBruijnGraph

        private static void populateDeBruijnGraph(int k,
                                          int n,
                                          Graph graph,
                                          java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> prohibit)
        Populates a Graph object with Nodes and Edges to create a De Bruijn graph for values k and n
        Parameters:
        k - Size of the alphabet
        n - Length of each code
        graph - The Graph to populate
        prohibit - List of prohibited codes that should not be added to the graph

      • generateDeBruijnWord

        public java.lang.String generateDeBruijnWord(int k,
                                             int n)
        Returns a valid De Bruijn word for values k and n Word is calculated by result of Hierholzers algorithm given Graph of size n-1
        Specified by:
        generateDeBruijnWord in interface Generator
        Parameters:
        k - Alphabet size
        n - Code length
        Returns:
        String containing the De Bruijn word

      • generateDeBruijnWord

        public java.lang.String generateDeBruijnWord(int k,
                                             int n,
                                             java.lang.String startNode)
        Returns a valid De Bruijn word for values k and n, beginning with the given code Word is calculated by result of Hierholzers algorithm given Graph of size n-1 and code to start with
        Parameters:
        k -
        n -
        startNode - The code the word should start with
        Returns:
        String containing the De Bruijn word

      • generateDeBruijnWord

        public java.lang.String generateDeBruijnWord(int k,
                                             int n,
                                             java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> prohibit)
        Returns a valid De Bruijn word for values k and n, not containing any codes in given list of prohibited codes Word is calculated by result of Hierholzers algorithm given Graph of size n-1 and prohibited codes
        Parameters:
        k -
        n -
        prohibit - Any codes that should not appear in the word
        Returns:
        String containing the De Bruijn word OR null if no path is found

      • findEulerianPath

        private java.util.ArrayList<Edge> findEulerianPath(Graph graph,
                                                   Node startNode)
        Finds a Eulerian path in a graph if one exists Will start from the given Node if it is not null
        Parameters:
        graph -
        startNode -
        Returns:
        List of Edges representing a Eulerian path OR null if no path exists

                                  Graph graph)
        Helper method Constructs list of unvisited Edges starting from the given Edge Marks each Edge as visited Ends when no further extension can be made
